154
(1) When the testator does not speak the official language, court interpreters shall be called as well as another two witnesses who know both the official and the testator's language; the will shall then be written in front of them, as the interpreter translated it into the official language.
(2) When the testator is mute, the court translator and two witnesses who are able to communicate with the testator shall be called for.
(3) The minutes of the drawing up of a will in the cases referred to in paragraphs one and two of this Article shall also be signed by the translator and the witnesses.
